item.title: Report X-2024110308
item.description:
Report X-2024110308

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Previously failed in HAP on 10/28 and 10/30. Caught on 11/4 and found that it had been repacked in a plain cardboard box. The original package was found inside with the exact same tracking ID on the label. Discovered 11/4 because tracking ID still had the code 97s on it which triggered error messages during the trailer loading process, and the DG Nav Specialist recognized the shipper name.

item.title: Report E-2024100300
item.description:
Report E-2024100300

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: LAKEVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed a spill of approximately three (3) gallons from one (1) five (5) gallon metal pail of AcromaPro Care Seal Sealant. Personnel advised the product was crushed by other freight and spilled. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the spill with absorbents and generated one (1) ten (10) of the spent absorbents and the spilled contents. They advised they also generated one (1) ten (10) gallon metal pail containing the pail that was crushed. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100357
item.description:
Report E-2024100357

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel approximately two (2) gallons of Satin Braco Clear released from sixteen (16) one (1) gallon metal cans due to being crushed in transit. The release impacted the trailer floor. Personnel advised they cleaned the trailer floor using rags rather than absorbents. Dayton Freight advised the generated two (2) ten (10) gallon poly drums of waste containing the crushed metal pails, product, and cardboard. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
